docs.title: giftpy
docs.text: Formally verified mathematical constants from the GIFT framework.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
giftpy provides access to mathematical constants derived from the GIFT (Geometric Information Field Theory) framework. All 13 exact relations are formally verified in both Lean 4 and Coq proof assistants.

from gift_core import *

print(SIN2_THETA_W)  # Fraction(3, 13)
print(TAU)           # Fraction(3472, 891)
print(DELTA_CP)      # 197

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text: Feature Description 13 Verified Relations All exact relations proven in Lean 4 and Coq Pure Python No external dependencies for core functionality Exact Arithmetic Uses fractions.Fraction for rational numbers Type Hints Full type annotations for IDE support

docs.title: The Constants
docs.text:
All constants derive from fixed topological structures:

  • E₈×E₈ gauge group: dim = 496
  • K₇ manifold: b₂ = 21, b₃ = 77
  • G₂ holonomy: dim = 14

No continuous parameters are adjusted to fit data.

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
from gift_core import PROVEN_RELATIONS

for relation in PROVEN_RELATIONS:
    print(f"{relation.symbol:12} = {relation.value}")

Output: 

sin²θ_W      = 3/13
τ            = 3472/891
det(g)       = 65/32
κ_T          = 1/61
δ_CP         = 197
m_τ/m_e      = 3477
m_s/m_d      = 20
Q_Koide      = 2/3
λ_H_num      = 17
H*           = 99
p₂           = 2
N_gen        = 3
dim(E₈×E₈)   = 496

docs.title: Citation
docs.text:
If using this package in academic work:

@software{gift_core,
  author = {GIFT Framework},
  title = {giftpy: Formally Verified GIFT Constants},
  url = {https://github.com/gift-framework/core},
  version = {0.1.0},
  year = {2024}
}

docs.title: Report Issues
docs.text:
Found a bug or have a question? Open an issue on GitHub:

  • Core repository issues
  • Main framework issues

docs.title: Suggest Improvements
docs.text: Ideas for new features, better documentation, or corrections are welcome. Please open an issue to discuss before starting work.

docs.title: Submit Code
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Create a feature branch
  3. Make your changes
  4. Run tests
  5. Submit a pull request

docs.title: Python Package
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/gift-framework/core.git
cd core
pip install -e ".[dev]"
pytest

docs.title: Lean 4 Proofs
docs.text:
cd Lean
lake build

docs.title: Coq Proofs
docs.text:
cd COQ
make

docs.title: Python
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8
  • Use type hints
  • Write docstrings for public functions
  • Add tests for new functionality
def compute_weinberg_angle(b2: int, b3: int, dim_g2: int) -> Fraction:
    """
    Compute the Weinberg angle from Betti numbers.

    Args:
        b2: Second Betti number
        b3: Third Betti number
        dim_g2: Dimension of G₂

    Returns:
        sin²θ_W as an exact fraction
    """
    return Fraction(b2, b3 + dim_g2)

docs.title: Lean 4
docs.text:
• Follow Mathlib conventions
  • Include docstrings for theorems
  • No sorry statements in final code
/-- The Weinberg angle sin²θ_W = b₂/(b₃ + dim G₂) equals 3/13 -/
theorem weinberg_angle_exact : (21 : ℚ) / 91 = 3 / 13 := by
  norm_num

docs.title: Coq
docs.text:
• Follow standard Coq conventions
  • Include comments for complex proofs
  • No Admitted statements in final code
(** The Weinberg angle sin²θ_W = b₂/(b₃ + dim G₂) equals 3/13 *)
Theorem weinberg_angle_exact : 21 # 91 == 3 # 13.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

docs.title: Python Tests
docs.text:
pytest tests/
pytest tests/ -v  # verbose
pytest tests/ --cov=gift_core  # with coverage

docs.title: Proof Verification
docs.text:
For Lean and Coq, successful compilation is the test:

# Lean
cd Lean && lake build

# Coq
cd COQ && make

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text: Documentation uses MkDocs with the Material theme.

docs.title: Build Locally
docs.text:
pip install mkdocs mkdocs-material mkdocstrings[python]
mkdocs serve

docs.title: Writing Documentation
docs.text:
• Use clear, concise language
  • Include code examples
  • Use proper mathematical notation with MathJax

docs.title: Pull Request Guidelines
docs.text:
1. One feature per PR: Keep changes focused
  2. Update tests: Add tests for new functionality
  3. Update docs: Document new features
  4. Pass CI: All checks must pass
  5. Clear description: Explain what and why

docs.title: Review Process
docs.text:
1. Maintainers will review your PR
  2. Address any feedback
  3. Once approved, your PR will be merged

docs.title: Questions?
docs.text:
• Open an issue for technical questions
  • Contact @GIFTheory for other inquiries

docs.title: License
docs.text: By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under the MIT License.

docs.title: From PyPI
docs.text:
The recommended installation method:

pip install giftpy

docs.title: From Source
docs.text:
Clone the repository and install in development mode:

git clone https://github.com/gift-framework/core.git
cd core
pip install -e .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
import gift_core
print(gift_core.__version__)

docs.title: Python Package
docs.text:
The core Python package has minimal dependencies:

  • Python ≥ 3.8
  • No external packages required (uses stdlib fractions)

docs.title: Formal Proofs (Optional)
docs.text:
To verify or modify the proofs:

Lean 4: 

cd Lean
curl -sSf https://get.elan-init.app | sh  # Install elan
lake build

Coq: 

cd COQ
# Requires Coq 8.17+
make

docs.title: Platform Support
docs.text: Platform Status Linux ✅ Tested macOS ✅ Tested Windows ✅ Tested

docs.title: Import Error
docs.text:
If you encounter: 

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'gift_core'

Ensure you installed giftpy (the PyPI package name), not gift_core (the module name):

pip install giftpy  # Correct

docs.title: Version Conflicts
docs.text:
To check your installed version:

pip show giftpy

To upgrade:

pip install --upgrade giftpy

docs.title: Import the Module
docs.text:
from gift_core import *

Or import specific items:

from gift_core import SIN2_THETA_W, TAU, DELTA_CP

docs.title: Access Constants
docs.text:
All topological inputs:

from gift_core import (
    DIM_E8,      # 248
    RANK_E8,     # 8
    DIM_E8XE8,   # 496
    B2,          # 21
    B3,          # 77
    DIM_G2,      # 14
    DIM_J3O,     # 27
    H_STAR,      # 99
)

docs.title: Access Derived Relations
docs.text:
from gift_core import (
    SIN2_THETA_W,  # Fraction(3, 13)
    TAU,           # Fraction(3472, 891)
    DET_G,         # Fraction(65, 32)
    KAPPA_T,       # Fraction(1, 61)
    DELTA_CP,      # 197
    M_TAU_M_E,     # 3477
    M_S_M_D,       # 20
    Q_KOIDE,       # Fraction(2, 3)
    LAMBDA_H_NUM,  # 17
    P2,            # 2
    N_GEN,         # 3
)

docs.title: Working with Fractions
docs.text:
Constants that are rational numbers are represented as fractions.Fraction:

from gift_core import SIN2_THETA_W

# Exact representation
print(SIN2_THETA_W)              # 3/13
print(SIN2_THETA_W.numerator)    # 3
print(SIN2_THETA_W.denominator)  # 13

# Convert to float
print(float(SIN2_THETA_W))       # 0.23076923076923078

# Arithmetic preserves exactness
result = SIN2_THETA_W * 13
print(result)                     # 3

docs.title: Iterating Over Relations
docs.text:
from gift_core import PROVEN_RELATIONS

for rel in PROVEN_RELATIONS:
    print(f"{rel.name}")
    print(f"  Symbol: {rel.symbol}")
    print(f"  Value:  {rel.value}")
    print(f"  Formula: {rel.formula}")
    print()

docs.title: Verification Status
docs.text:
Check which relations are formally verified:

from gift_core import PROVEN_RELATIONS

# All relations are proven in both Lean 4 and Coq
for rel in PROVEN_RELATIONS:
    print(f"{rel.symbol}: Lean={rel.lean_proven}, Coq={rel.coq_proven}")

docs.title: Example: Computing Observables
docs.text:
from gift_core import *

# Weinberg angle
sin2_theta_w = B2 / (B3 + DIM_G2)
print(f"sin²θ_W = {B2}/{B3 + DIM_G2} = {sin2_theta_w}")
# Output: sin²θ_W = 21/91 = 3/13

# Hierarchy parameter
tau = (DIM_E8XE8 * B2) / (DIM_J3O * H_STAR)
print(f"τ = ({DIM_E8XE8} × {B2})/({DIM_J3O} × {H_STAR}) = {tau}")
# Output: τ = (496 × 21)/(27 × 99) = 3472/891

# CP violation phase
delta_cp = 7 * DIM_G2 + H_STAR
print(f"δ_CP = 7 × {DIM_G2} + {H_STAR} = {delta_cp}°")
# Output: δ_CP = 7 × 14 + 99 = 197°

docs.title: Example: Comparison with Experiment
docs.text:
from gift_core import SIN2_THETA_W, DELTA_CP

# Experimental values (PDG 2024)
sin2_exp = 0.23122  # ± 0.00003
delta_exp = 197     # ± 24°

# GIFT predictions
sin2_gift = float(SIN2_THETA_W)  # 0.23077

# Deviation
deviation = abs(sin2_gift - sin2_exp) / sin2_exp * 100
print(f"sin²θ_W deviation: {deviation:.2f}%")
# Output: sin²θ_W deviation: 0.19%

print(f"δ_CP: GIFT = {DELTA_CP}°, Exp = {delta_exp}° ± 24°")
# Output: δ_CP: GIFT = 197°, Exp = 197° ± 24°

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• API Reference: Complete list of all constants
  • Formal Proofs: How the relations are verified
  • Theory Background: Mathematical foundations

docs.title: Constants Reference
docs.text: All constants in gift_core derive from fixed topological structures. No continuous parameters are adjusted.

docs.title: Topological Inputs
docs.text: These are the fundamental topological integers from which all relations derive.

docs.title: E₈ Structure
docs.text:
Constant Value Description DIM_E8 248 Dimension of E₈ Lie algebra RANK_E8 8 Rank of E₈ (Cartan subalgebra dimension) DIM_E8XE8 496 Dimension of E₈×E₈ (heterotic gauge group) WEYL_FACTOR 5 From E₈ Weyl group factorization: 2¹⁴ × 3⁵ × 5² × 7 E8_ROOTS 240 Number of roots in E₈ root system 
from gift_core import DIM_E8, RANK_E8, DIM_E8XE8, WEYL_FACTOR

print(DIM_E8)       # 248
print(DIM_E8XE8)    # 496 = 2 × 248
print(WEYL_FACTOR)  # 5

docs.title: K₇ Manifold
docs.text:
Constant Value Description B2 21 Second Betti number b₂(K₇) B3 77 Third Betti number b₃(K₇) DIM_K7 7 Dimension of the internal manifold

The Betti numbers arise from the Twisted Connected Sum construction:

  • Quintic threefold: b₂ = 11, b₃ = 40
  • Complete intersection CI(2,2,2): b₂ = 10, b₃ = 37
  • Sum: b₂ = 21, b₃ = 77
from gift_core import B2, B3, DIM_K7

print(B2)      # 21
print(B3)      # 77
print(DIM_K7)  # 7

docs.title: G₂ Holonomy
docs.text:
Constant Value Description DIM_G2 14 Dimension of G₂ exceptional Lie group RANK_G2 2 Rank of G₂ 
from gift_core import DIM_G2, RANK_G2

print(DIM_G2)   # 14
print(RANK_G2)  # 2

docs.title: Exceptional Jordan Algebra
docs.text:
Constant Value Description DIM_J3O 27 Dimension of J₃(𝕆), the exceptional Jordan algebra

The 27 arises from 3×3 Hermitian matrices over octonions: 3 diagonal + 3×8 off-diagonal = 27.

from gift_core import DIM_J3O

print(DIM_J3O)  # 27

docs.title: Derived Structural Constants
docs.text:
Constant Value Formula Description H_STAR 99 b₂ + b₃ + 1 Effective cohomological dimension P2 2 dim(G₂) / dim(K₇) Binary duality parameter N_GEN 3 Topological constraint Number of generations 
from gift_core import H_STAR, P2, N_GEN

print(H_STAR)  # 99 = 21 + 77 + 1
print(P2)      # 2 = 14 / 7
print(N_GEN)   # 3

docs.title: Physical Relations
docs.text: These are the 13 exact relations, all formally verified in Lean 4 and Coq.

docs.title: Gauge Sector
docs.text:
Constant Value Formula SIN2_THETA_W 3/13 b₂ / (b₃ + dim G₂) = 21/91 
from gift_core import SIN2_THETA_W

print(SIN2_THETA_W)              # 3/13
print(float(SIN2_THETA_W))       # 0.23076923...

docs.title: Hierarchy Parameter
docs.text:
Constant Value Formula TAU 3472/891 (dim E₈×E₈ × b₂) / (dim J₃(𝕆) × H*) 
from gift_core import TAU

print(TAU)          # 3472/891
print(float(TAU))   # 3.8967...

docs.title: Metric and Torsion
docs.text:
Constant Value Formula DET_G 65/32 (Weyl × 13) / 32 KAPPA_T 1/61 1 / (b₃ - dim G₂ - 2) 
from gift_core import DET_G, KAPPA_T

print(DET_G)    # 65/32
print(KAPPA_T)  # 1/61

docs.title: Neutrino Sector
docs.text:
Constant Value Formula DELTA_CP 197 7 × dim(G₂) + H* = 98 + 99 
from gift_core import DELTA_CP

print(DELTA_CP)  # 197 (degrees)

docs.title: Fermion Masses
docs.text:
Constant Value Formula M_TAU_M_E 3477 dim(K₇) + 10×dim(E₈) + 10×H* M_S_M_D 20 4 × Weyl = b₂ - 1 Q_KOIDE 2/3 dim(G₂) / b₂ = 14/21 
from gift_core import M_TAU_M_E, M_S_M_D, Q_KOIDE

print(M_TAU_M_E)  # 3477
print(M_S_M_D)    # 20
print(Q_KOIDE)    # 2/3

docs.title: Higgs Sector
docs.text:
Constant Value Formula LAMBDA_H_NUM 17 dim(G₂) + N_gen = 14 + 3

The Higgs self-coupling is λ_H = √(17/32).

from gift_core import LAMBDA_H_NUM

print(LAMBDA_H_NUM)  # 17

docs.title: Summary Table
docs.text: Symbol Constant Value Type sin²θ_W SIN2_THETA_W 3/13 Fraction τ TAU 3472/891 Fraction det(g) DET_G 65/32 Fraction κ_T KAPPA_T 1/61 Fraction δ_CP DELTA_CP 197 int m_τ/m_e M_TAU_M_E 3477 int m_s/m_d M_S_M_D 20 int Q Q_KOIDE 2/3 Fraction λ_H num LAMBDA_H_NUM 17 int H* H_STAR 99 int p₂ P2 2 int N_gen N_GEN 3 int dim(E₈×E₈) DIM_E8XE8 496 int

docs.title: Relations Reference
docs.text: The PROVEN_RELATIONS list contains all 13 exact relations with metadata about their verification status.

docs.title: The Relation Class
docs.text:
Each relation is represented as a named tuple with the following fields:

class Relation(NamedTuple):
    name: str           # Human-readable name
    symbol: str         # Mathematical symbol
    value: Any          # The value (int or Fraction)
    formula: str        # Derivation formula
    lean_proven: bool   # Verified in Lean 4
    coq_proven: bool    # Verified in Coq

docs.title: Iterate Over All Relations
docs.text:
from gift_core import PROVEN_RELATIONS

for rel in PROVEN_RELATIONS:
    print(f"{rel.symbol} = {rel.value}")

docs.title: Access by Index
docs.text:
from gift_core import PROVEN_RELATIONS

weinberg = PROVEN_RELATIONS[0]
print(weinberg.name)     # "Weinberg angle"
print(weinberg.symbol)   # "sin²θ_W"
print(weinberg.value)    # Fraction(3, 13)
print(weinberg.formula)  # "b₂/(b₃ + dim G₂)"

docs.title: Filter Relations
docs.text:
from gift_core import PROVEN_RELATIONS
from fractions import Fraction

# Get only fractional relations
fractional = [r for r in PROVEN_RELATIONS if isinstance(r.value, Fraction)]

# Get only integer relations
integer = [r for r in PROVEN_RELATIONS if isinstance(r.value, int)]

docs.title: 1. Weinberg Angle
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Weinberg angle",
    symbol="sin²θ_W",
    value=Fraction(3, 13),
    formula="b₂/(b₃ + dim G₂) = 21/91",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

Derivation: The Weinberg angle emerges from the ratio of gauge field components.

\[\sin^2\theta_W = \frac{b_2}{b_3 + \dim G_2} = \frac{21}{77 + 14} = \frac{21}{91} = \frac{3}{13}\]

docs.title: 2. Hierarchy Parameter
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Hierarchy parameter",
    symbol="τ",
    value=Fraction(3472, 891),
    formula="(dim E₈×E₈ × b₂)/(dim J₃(𝕆) × H*)",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

Derivation:

\[\tau = \frac{\dim(E_8 \times E_8) \cdot b_2}{\dim(J_3(\mathbb{O})) \cdot H^*} = \frac{496 \times 21}{27 \times 99} = \frac{10416}{2673} = \frac{3472}{891}\]

docs.title: 3. Metric Determinant
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Metric determinant",
    symbol="det(g)",
    value=Fraction(65, 32),
    formula="(Weyl × 13)/32 = 5×13/32",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 4. Torsion Magnitude
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Torsion magnitude",
    symbol="κ_T",
    value=Fraction(1, 61),
    formula="1/(b₃ - dim G₂ - 2) = 1/(77-14-2)",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 5. CP Violation Phase
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="CP violation phase",
    symbol="δ_CP",
    value=197,
    formula="7 × dim(G₂) + H* = 98 + 99",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

Derivation:

\[\delta_{CP} = 7 \cdot \dim(G_2) + H^* = 7 \times 14 + 99 = 98 + 99 = 197°\]

docs.title: 6. Tau-Electron Mass Ratio
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Tau-electron mass ratio",
    symbol="m_τ/m_e",
    value=3477,
    formula="dim(K₇) + 10×dim(E₈) + 10×H*",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

Derivation:

\[\frac{m_\tau}{m_e} = \dim(K_7) + 10 \cdot \dim(E_8) + 10 \cdot H^* = 7 + 2480 + 990 = 3477\]

docs.title: 7. Strange-Down Mass Ratio
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Strange-down mass ratio",
    symbol="m_s/m_d",
    value=20,
    formula="4 × Weyl = b₂ - 1",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 8. Koide Parameter
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Koide parameter",
    symbol="Q_Koide",
    value=Fraction(2, 3),
    formula="dim(G₂)/b₂ = 14/21",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 9. Higgs Coupling Numerator
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Higgs coupling numerator",
    symbol="λ_H_num",
    value=17,
    formula="dim(G₂) + N_gen = 14 + 3",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 10. Cohomological Dimension
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Cohomological dimension",
    symbol="H*",
    value=99,
    formula="b₂ + b₃ + 1 = 21 + 77 + 1",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 11. Binary Duality
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Binary duality",
    symbol="p₂",
    value=2,
    formula="dim(G₂)/dim(K₇) = 14/7",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 12. Generation Number
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="Generation number",
    symbol="N_gen",
    value=3,
    formula="Unique solution to (rank E₈ + N)×b₂ = N×b₃",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: 13. E₈×E₈ Dimension
docs.text:
Relation(
    name="E8×E8 dimension",
    symbol="dim(E₈×E₈)",
    value=496,
    formula="2 × dim(E₈) = 2 × 248",
    lean_proven=True,
    coq_proven=True
)

docs.title: Verification Status
docs.text:
All 13 relations are proven in both proof assistants:

from gift_core import PROVEN_RELATIONS

lean_count = sum(1 for r in PROVEN_RELATIONS if r.lean_proven)
coq_count = sum(1 for r in PROVEN_RELATIONS if r.coq_proven)

print(f"Lean 4: {lean_count}/13 proven")  # 13/13
print(f"Coq:    {coq_count}/13 proven")   # 13/13

docs.title: Utilities Reference
docs.text: Helper functions for working with GIFT constants.

docs.title: verify_relation
docs.text:
Check that a relation holds exactly:

from gift_core import verify_relation, B2, B3, DIM_G2, SIN2_THETA_W
from fractions import Fraction

# Verify sin²θ_W = b₂/(b₃ + dim G₂)
result = verify_relation(
    computed=Fraction(B2, B3 + DIM_G2),
    expected=SIN2_THETA_W
)
print(result)  # True

docs.title: verify_all_relations
docs.text:
Verify all 13 relations at once:

from gift_core import verify_all_relations

results = verify_all_relations()
print(f"All verified: {all(results.values())}")

docs.title: to_decimal
docs.text:
Convert a Fraction to decimal with specified precision:

from gift_core import to_decimal, SIN2_THETA_W

value = to_decimal(SIN2_THETA_W, precision=10)
print(value)  # "0.2307692308"

docs.title: to_latex
docs.text:
Generate LaTeX representation:

from gift_core import to_latex, SIN2_THETA_W

latex = to_latex(SIN2_THETA_W)
print(latex)  # "\\frac{3}{13}"

docs.title: compare_with_experiment
docs.text:
Compare GIFT predictions with experimental values:

from gift_core import compare_with_experiment

# Returns deviation in percent
deviation = compare_with_experiment(
    gift_value=0.23077,
    exp_value=0.23122,
    exp_error=0.00003
)
print(f"Deviation: {deviation:.2f}%")  # 0.19%
print(f"Within 1σ: {deviation < 0.03/0.23122*100}")

docs.title: export_to_dict
docs.text:
Export all constants as a dictionary:

from gift_core import export_to_dict

data = export_to_dict()
print(data['SIN2_THETA_W'])  # {'value': '3/13', 'float': 0.23076923...}

docs.title: export_to_json
docs.text:
Export all constants as JSON:

from gift_core import export_to_json

json_str = export_to_json(indent=2)
print(json_str)

Output: 

{
  "topological_inputs": {
    "DIM_E8": 248,
    "B2": 21,
    "B3": 77,
    ...
  },
  "derived_relations": {
    "SIN2_THETA_W": "3/13",
    "TAU": "3472/891",
    ...
  }
}

docs.title: compute_sin2_theta_w
docs.text:
Compute sin²θ_W from Betti numbers:

from gift_core import compute_sin2_theta_w

result = compute_sin2_theta_w(b2=21, b3=77, dim_g2=14)
print(result)  # Fraction(3, 13)

docs.title: compute_tau
docs.text:
Compute the hierarchy parameter:

from gift_core import compute_tau

result = compute_tau(
    dim_e8xe8=496,
    b2=21,
    dim_j3o=27,
    h_star=99
)
print(result)  # Fraction(3472, 891)

docs.title: compute_delta_cp
docs.text:
Compute the CP violation phase:

from gift_core import compute_delta_cp

result = compute_delta_cp(dim_g2=14, h_star=99)
print(result)  # 197

docs.title: is_valid_k7
docs.text:
Check if Betti numbers are valid for a K₇ manifold:

from gift_core import is_valid_k7

# Valid TCS construction
print(is_valid_k7(b2=21, b3=77))  # True

# Invalid
print(is_valid_k7(b2=20, b3=77))  # False

docs.title: Coq Proofs
docs.text: The GIFT framework constants are formally verified in Coq using the standard library.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Coq 8.17+ (8.18 recommended)
  • Make

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
cd COQ
make

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
COQ/
├── _CoqProject           # Project configuration
├── Makefile              # Build rules
├── GIFT_Unified.v        # Main unified proof file
└── (or modular structure similar to Lean)

docs.title: Main Theorem
docs.text:
Theorem GIFT_framework_certified (G : GIFTStructure) 
  (H : is_zero_parameter G) :
  (* Structural *)
  G.(gs_p2) = 2 /\
  G.(gs_N_gen) = 3 /\
  G.(gs_H_star) = 99 /\

  (* Weinberg angle: sin²θ_W = 3/13 *)
  inject_Z (Z.of_nat G.(gs_b2)) / 
    inject_Z (Z.of_nat (G.(gs_b3) + G.(gs_dim_G2))) == 3 # 13 /\

  (* Hierarchy parameter: τ = 3472/891 *)
  inject_Z (Z.of_nat G.(gs_dim_E8xE8)) * inject_Z (Z.of_nat G.(gs_b2)) /
    (inject_Z (Z.of_nat G.(gs_dim_J3O)) * inject_Z (Z.of_nat G.(gs_H_star))) 
    == 3472 # 891 /\

  (* ... remaining relations ... *)
  True.
Proof.
  destruct H as [HE8 [Hrank [HE8xE8 [HWeyl [HJ3O [HK7 [Hb2 [Hb3 
    [HG2 [HH [Hp2 HNgen]]]]]]]]]]].
  repeat split.
  - exact Hp2.
  - exact HNgen.
  - exact HH.
  - rewrite Hb2, Hb3, HG2. reflexivity.
  - rewrite HE8xE8, Hb2, HJ3O, HH. reflexivity.
  (* ... *)
Qed.

docs.title: Individual Certified Relations
docs.text:
(* Weinberg angle *)
Theorem weinberg_angle_certified : 21 # 91 == 3 # 13.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* Hierarchy parameter *)
Theorem tau_certified : (496 * 21) # (27 * 99) == 3472 # 891.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* Metric determinant *)
Theorem det_g_certified : (5 * 13) # 32 == 65 # 32.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* Torsion magnitude *)
Theorem kappa_T_certified : 1 # 61 == 1 # 61.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* CP violation phase *)
Theorem delta_CP_certified : 7 * 14 + 99 = 197.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* Tau-electron mass ratio *)
Theorem m_tau_m_e_certified : 7 + 10 * 248 + 10 * 99 = 3477.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* Strange-down mass ratio *)
Theorem m_s_m_d_certified : 4 * 5 = 20.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* Koide parameter *)
Theorem koide_certified : 14 # 21 == 2 # 3.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(* Higgs coupling numerator *)
Theorem lambda_H_num_certified : 14 + 3 = 17.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

docs.title: Required Imports
docs.text:
From Coq Require Import Arith.
From Coq Require Import ZArith.
From Coq Require Import QArith.
From Coq Require Import Lia.

Open Scope Q_scope.

docs.title: Tactics Used
docs.text: Tactic Purpose Lean Equivalent reflexivity Definitional equality rfl lia Linear integer arithmetic omega ring Ring operations ring field Field operations field unfold Definition expansion unfold rewrite Equality substitution rw destruct Case analysis cases

docs.title: Check for Admitted
docs.text:
grep -r "Admitted" COQ/
# Should return empty

docs.title: Build Output
docs.text:
COQC GIFT_Unified.v

=================================================================
     VERIFICATION SUCCESSFUL
=================================================================

  Status:          All proofs verified
  Admitted count:  0
  Axioms used:     None (closed under global context)

docs.title: Example: Complete Proof
docs.text:
(** * Weinberg Angle Derivation *)

From Coq Require Import Arith QArith.

Open Scope Q_scope.

(** Topological inputs *)
Definition b2 : nat := 21.
Definition b3 : nat := 77.
Definition dim_G2 : nat := 14.

(** The Weinberg angle formula *)
Definition sin2_theta_W : Q := 
  inject_Z (Z.of_nat b2) / inject_Z (Z.of_nat (b3 + dim_G2)).

(** Proof that it equals 3/13 *)
Theorem sin2_theta_W_exact : sin2_theta_W == 3 # 13.
Proof.
  unfold sin2_theta_W, b2, b3, dim_G2.
  reflexivity.
Qed.

(** Direct arithmetic verification *)
Theorem sin2_simplified : 21 # 91 == 3 # 13.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

(** Denominator structure *)
Theorem denom_is_91 : b3 + dim_G2 = 91.
Proof. unfold b3, dim_G2. reflexivity. Qed.

(** Factorization *)
Theorem factor_91 : 91 = 7 * 13.
Proof. reflexivity. Qed.

Close Scope Q_scope.

docs.title: GIFTStructure Record
docs.text:
Record GIFTStructure : Type := mkGIFT {
  (* E₈ data *)
  gs_dim_E8 : nat;
  gs_rank_E8 : nat;
  gs_dim_E8xE8 : nat;
  gs_Weyl_factor : nat;
  gs_dim_J3O : nat;

  (* K₇ data *)
  gs_dim_K7 : nat;
  gs_b2 : nat;
  gs_b3 : nat;

  (* G₂ data *)
  gs_dim_G2 : nat;

  (* Derived *)
  gs_H_star : nat;
  gs_p2 : nat;
  gs_N_gen : nat
}.

Definition GIFT_default : GIFTStructure := {|
  gs_dim_E8 := 248;
  gs_rank_E8 := 8;
  gs_dim_E8xE8 := 496;
  gs_Weyl_factor := 5;
  gs_dim_J3O := 27;
  gs_dim_K7 := 7;
  gs_b2 := 21;
  gs_b3 := 77;
  gs_dim_G2 := 14;
  gs_H_star := 99;
  gs_p2 := 2;
  gs_N_gen := 3
|}.

docs.title: Extending the Proofs
docs.text:
To add a new theorem:

  1. Open the .v file
  2. Add required imports
  3. State the theorem using Theorem or Lemma
  4. Prove using tactics (typically reflexivity for arithmetic)
  5. End with Qed.
  6. Run make to verify
(* Example: New relation *)
Theorem my_new_relation : 
  (* some computation *) = expected_value.
Proof.
  reflexivity.  (* or other tactics *)
Qed.

docs.title: Lean 4 Proofs

• Lean 4.14.0+

# Install elan
curl -sSf https://get.elan-init.app | sh

# Clone and build
cd Lean
lake build

docs.title: Main Theorem
docs.text:
theorem GIFT_framework_certified (G : GIFTStructure) 
    (h : is_zero_parameter G) :
  G.p2 = 2 ∧ 
  N_gen = 3 ∧ 
  G.H_star = 99 ∧
  sin²θ_W = 3/13 ∧ 
  τ = 3472/891 ∧ 
  det_g = 65/32 ∧
  κ_T = 1/61 ∧ 
  δ_CP = 197 ∧ 
  m_τ_m_e = 3477 ∧
  m_s_m_d = 20 ∧ 
  Q_Koide = 2/3 ∧ 
  λ_H_numerator = 17 := by
  -- Proof by computation
  simp [is_zero_parameter] at h
  norm_num

docs.title: Individual Relations
docs.text:
-- Weinberg angle
theorem sin2_theta_W_exact : (21 : ℚ) / 91 = 3 / 13 := by norm_num

-- Hierarchy parameter  
theorem tau_exact : (496 * 21 : ℚ) / (27 * 99) = 3472 / 891 := by norm_num

-- CP violation
theorem delta_CP_exact : 7 * 14 + 99 = 197 := by norm_num

-- Mass ratio
theorem m_tau_m_e_exact : 7 + 10 * 248 + 10 * 99 = 3477 := by norm_num

-- Koide
theorem koide_exact : (14 : ℚ) / 21 = 2 / 3 := by norm_num

docs.title: Tactics Used
docs.text: Tactic Purpose Example norm_num Numerical computation (21 : ℚ) / 91 = 3 / 13 decide Decidable propositions Boolean checks ring Ring arithmetic Polynomial identities simp Simplification Unfolding definitions

docs.text:
grep -r "sorry" Lean/GIFT/
# Should return empty

docs.title: Build Output
docs.text:
Building GIFT
[1/17] Building GIFT.Algebra.E8RootSystem
[2/17] Building GIFT.Algebra.E8WeylGroup
...
[17/17] Building GIFT.Certificate.Summary
Build completed successfully

docs.title: Example: Weinberg Angle Proof
docs.text:
import Mathlib.Data.Rat.Basic

/-- The Weinberg angle sin²θ_W = b₂/(b₃ + dim G₂) = 21/91 = 3/13 -/
theorem weinberg_angle_from_topology :
    let b2 : ℚ := 21
    let b3 : ℚ := 77  
    let dim_G2 : ℚ := 14
    b2 / (b3 + dim_G2) = 3 / 13 := by
  norm_num

/-- Verification that 21/91 simplifies to 3/13 -/
theorem weinberg_simplification : (21 : ℚ) / 91 = 3 / 13 := by
  norm_num

/-- 91 = 7 × 13 -/
theorem denominator_factorization : 91 = 7 * 13 := by
  norm_num

/-- 21 = 3 × 7, so 21/91 = (3×7)/(7×13) = 3/13 -/
theorem weinberg_by_factorization : 
    (21 : ℚ) / 91 = (3 * 7) / (7 * 13) := by
  norm_num

docs.title: Extending the Proofs
docs.text:
To add a new theorem:

  1. Create a .lean file in the appropriate directory
  2. Import required modules
  3. State the theorem
  4. Prove using tactics (typically norm_num for arithmetic)
  5. Run lake build to verify
-- Example: New relation
theorem my_new_relation : 
    let x := some_computation
    x = expected_value := by
  norm_num  -- or other tactics

docs.title: Formal Proofs Overview
docs.text: All 13 exact relations in GIFT are formally verified using proof assistants. This provides machine-checked guarantees that the mathematical relationships hold exactly.

docs.title: Eliminating Human Error
docs.text: Traditional mathematical proofs can contain subtle errors. Proof assistants mechanically verify every logical step, eliminating this possibility for the verified statements.

docs.title: Ensuring Logical Consistency
docs.text: The proof assistants ensure that no hidden assumptions or circular reasoning are present in the derivations.

docs.title: Reproducibility
docs.text: Anyone can run the proofs and verify the results independently.

docs.title: What Is Proven?
docs.text:
The formal proofs verify arithmetic identities such as:

  • 21/91 = 3/13 ✓
  • 496 × 21 / (27 × 99) = 3472/891 ✓
  • 7 × 14 + 99 = 197 ✓

These are mathematical facts, not physical claims. The proofs do not verify that these relations correspond to physical reality—that requires experimental verification.

docs.title: Lean 4
docs.text:
• Version: Lean 4.14.0
  • Library: Mathlib 4.14.0
  • Modules: 17
  • Theorems: ~100
  • Sorry statements: 0

View Lean proofs →

docs.title: Coq
docs.text:
• Version: Coq 8.18+
  • Library: Coq stdlib
  • Modules: 21
  • Theorems: ~100
  • Admitted statements: 0

View Coq proofs →

docs.title: Lean 4
docs.text:
cd Lean
lake build

Expected output: 

Build completed successfully.

docs.title: Coq
docs.text:
cd COQ
make

Expected output: 

COQC GIFT_Unified.v
All proofs verified.

docs.title: What Is NOT Proven
docs.text:
The formal proofs do not establish:

  1. That E₈×E₈ is the correct gauge group for physics
  2. That K₇ with these Betti numbers exists physically
  3. That the cohomology-to-physics map is correct
  4. That the predictions match experiment

These require physical arguments and experimental verification, not mathematical proof.

docs.title: Cross-Validation Value
docs.text:
Having proofs in two independent proof assistants (Lean 4 and Coq) provides:

  • Different implementations catch different bugs
  • Different type theories (both are sound)
  • Community verification in both ecosystems

docs.title: Theory Background
docs.text: This page provides a brief overview of the mathematical structures underlying the GIFT framework. For the complete treatment, see the full framework documentation.

docs.title: The Parameter Problem
docs.text:
The Standard Model of particle physics contains 19 free parameters:

  • 6 quark masses
  • 3 charged lepton masses
  • 3 neutrino masses (or mass differences)
  • 3 CKM mixing angles + 1 CP phase
  • 3 PMNS mixing angles + 1 CP phase
  • Strong coupling constant
  • Weak coupling constant
  • Higgs mass and VEV

These parameters are measured experimentally but not predicted by the theory. The GIFT framework explores whether they could emerge from topological invariants.

docs.title: E₈ Exceptional Lie Group
docs.text: E₈ is the largest exceptional simple Lie group.

docs.title: Key Properties
docs.text: Property Value Dimension 248 Rank 8 Root count 240 Weyl group order 696,729,600 = 2¹⁴ × 3⁵ × 5² × 7

docs.title: E₈×E₈
docs.text: The product group E₈×E₈ appears in heterotic string theory as the gauge group. Its dimension is 496.

docs.title: Weyl Factor
docs.text: The Weyl group order factorization 2¹⁴ × 3⁵ × 5² × 7 contains a unique non-trivial perfect square: 5². The base 5 is called the Weyl factor and appears in several GIFT relations.

docs.title: G₂ Holonomy
docs.text: G₂ is the smallest exceptional Lie group, with dimension 14 and rank 2.

docs.title: G₂ Holonomy Manifolds
docs.text:
A 7-dimensional Riemannian manifold with holonomy group contained in G₂ admits a parallel 3-form φ (the associative form) and a parallel 4-form *φ.

These manifolds are Ricci-flat and have special cohomological properties relevant to string/M-theory compactifications.

docs.title: The 3-Form φ
docs.text:
The G₂ 3-form on ℝ⁷ can be written:

\[\varphi = dx^{123} + dx^{145} + dx^{167} + dx^{246} - dx^{257} - dx^{347} - dx^{356}\]

where \(dx^{ijk} = dx^i \wedge dx^j \wedge dx^k\).

docs.title: K₇: Twisted Connected Sum
docs.text: The K₇ manifold in GIFT is constructed using the Twisted Connected Sum (TCS) method developed by Kovalev.

docs.title: Building Blocks
docs.text:
Two asymptotically cylindrical Calabi-Yau threefolds:

  1. Quintic threefold in ℙ⁴: b₂ = 11, b₃ = 40
  2. Complete intersection CI(2,2,2) in ℙ⁶: b₂ = 10, b₃ = 37

docs.title: Gluing
docs.text: The TCS construction glues these along their cylindrical ends, producing a compact G₂ manifold.

docs.title: Cohomology-to-Physics Map
docs.text:
In string/M-theory compactifications, cohomology groups map to physical fields:

Cohomology Physical Interpretation H²(K₇) Gauge field components (21 forms) H³(K₇) Matter field components (77 forms)

docs.title: Generation Counting
docs.text:
The number of generations N satisfies:

\[(\text{rank}(E_8) + N) \times b_2 = N \times b_3\] \[(8 + N) \times 21 = N \times 77\] \[168 + 21N = 77N\] \[168 = 56N\] \[N = 3\]

This gives exactly three generations.

docs.title: The Exceptional Jordan Algebra
docs.text: J₃(𝕆) is the algebra of 3×3 Hermitian matrices over the octonions 𝕆.

docs.title: Dimension
docs.text:
• 3 diagonal entries (real): 3
  • 3 off-diagonal entries (octonionic): 3 × 8 = 24
  • Total: 27

docs.title: Relation to E₆
docs.text: The 27-dimensional fundamental representation of E₆ is the exceptional Jordan algebra. This connects to the E₈ → E₆ branching where the 27 appears.

docs.title: H* Parameter
docs.text:
The effective cohomological dimension:

\[H^* = b_2 + b_3 + 1 = 21 + 77 + 1 = 99\]

This parameter appears in multiple GIFT relations including τ and δ_CP.

docs.title: G₂ Holonomy
docs.text:
• Joyce, D. D. (2000). Compact Manifolds with Special Holonomy. Oxford University Press.
  • Kovalev, A. (2003). Twisted connected sums and special Riemannian holonomy. J. reine angew. Math.

docs.title: E₈ and String Theory
docs.text:
• Green, M. B., Schwarz, J. H., & Witten, E. (1987). Superstring Theory. Cambridge University Press.
  • Gross, D. J., Harvey, J. A., Martinec, E., & Rohm, R. (1985). Heterotic string theory. Nuclear Physics B.

docs.title: M-Theory on G₂
docs.text: • Acharya, B. S., & Gukov, S. (2004). M theory and singularities of exceptional holonomy manifolds. Physics Reports.

docs.title: Derivations
docs.text: This page shows how each of the 13 exact relations is derived from topological invariants.

docs.title: Input Constants
docs.text:
All derivations use only these fixed topological integers:

Symbol Value Origin dim(E₈) 248 E₈ Lie algebra dimension rank(E₈) 8 Cartan subalgebra dimension dim(E₈×E₈) 496 Product group: 2 × 248 Weyl 5 From b₂ 21 Second Betti number of K₇ b₃ 77 Third Betti number of K₇ dim(G₂) 14 G₂ Lie group dimension dim(K₇) 7 Manifold dimension dim(J₃(𝕆)) 27 Exceptional Jordan algebra

docs.title: 1. Weinberg Angle
docs.text: \[\sin^2\theta_W = \frac{b_2}{b_3 + \dim(G_2)}\]

docs.title: Result
docs.text:
\[\sin^2\theta_W = \frac{3}{13} \approx 0.2308\]

Experimental value: 0.23122 ± 0.00003 Deviation: 0.19%

docs.title: 2. Hierarchy Parameter τ
docs.text:
\[\tau = \frac{\dim(E_8 \times E_8) \cdot b_2}{\dim(J_3(\mathbb{O})) \cdot H^*}\]

where H* = b₂ + b₃ + 1 = 99.

docs.title: 3. Metric Determinant
docs.text: \[\det(g) = \frac{\text{Weyl} \times 13}{32}\]

docs.title: Result
docs.text:
\[\kappa_T = \frac{1}{61} \approx 0.0164\]

Note: 61 is the 18th prime number.

docs.title: 5. CP Violation Phase
docs.text: \[\delta_{CP} = 7 \cdot \dim(G_2) + H^*\]

docs.title: Result
docs.text:
\[\delta_{CP} = 197°\]

Experimental value: 197° ± 24° (T2K/NOvA combined) DUNE sensitivity: ±5° by 2030

docs.title: 6. Tau-Electron Mass Ratio
docs.text: \[\frac{m_\tau}{m_e} = \dim(K_7) + 10 \cdot \dim(E_8) + 10 \cdot H^*\]

docs.title: Result
docs.text:
\[\frac{m_\tau}{m_e} = 3477\]

Experimental value: 3477.23 ± 0.23 Deviation: 0.007%

docs.title: 7. Strange-Down Mass Ratio
docs.text: \[\frac{m_s}{m_d} = 4 \times \text{Weyl} = b_2 - 1\]

docs.title: Calculation
docs.text:
\[\frac{m_s}{m_d} = 4 \times 5 = 20\]

Or equivalently:

\[\frac{m_s}{m_d} = 21 - 1 = 20\]

docs.title: Result
docs.text:
\[\frac{m_s}{m_d} = 20\]

Experimental value: 20.2 ± 1.5 Deviation: 1.0%

docs.title: Result
docs.text:
\[Q = \frac{2}{3} \approx 0.6667\]

Koide's original formula: Q = (m_e + m_μ + m_τ) / (√m_e + √m_μ + √m_τ)² = 0.6666...

docs.title: 9. Higgs Coupling Numerator
docs.text: \[\lambda_H = \sqrt{\frac{\dim(G_2) + N_{gen}}{2^{\text{Weyl}}}}\]

docs.title: Numerator
docs.text: \[\text{numerator} = \dim(G_2) + N_{gen} = 14 + 3 = 17\]

docs.title: Denominator
docs.text: \[\text{denominator} = 2^{\text{Weyl}} = 2^5 = 32\]

docs.title: Result
docs.text: \[\lambda_H = \sqrt{\frac{17}{32}} \approx 0.729\]

docs.title: 12. Generation Number
docs.text:
N_gen is the unique positive integer satisfying:

\[(\text{rank}(E_8) + N) \times b_2 = N \times b_3\]

docs.title: 13. E₈×E₈ Dimension
docs.text: \[\dim(E_8 \times E_8) = 2 \times \dim(E_8)\]

docs.title: Calculation
docs.text: \[\dim(E_8 \times E_8) = 2 \times 248 = 496\]

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
All 13 relations are arithmetic identities involving only the topological integers. No continuous parameters are adjusted.

Relation Formula Value sin²θ_W b₂/(b₃ + dim G₂) 3/13 τ (496×21)/(27×99) 3472/891 det(g) 5×13/32 65/32 κ_T 1/(77-14-2) 1/61 δ_CP 7×14 + 99 197 m_τ/m_e 7 + 2480 + 990 3477 m_s/m_d 4×5 20 Q_Koide 14/21 2/3 λ_H √(17/32) √17/√32 H* 21 + 77 + 1 99 p₂ 14/7 2 N_gen constraint solution 3 dim(E₈×E₈) 2×248 496
